programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: No. 8 seed Oregon State (47-14-1) is a three-time champion after winning back-to back titles in 2006-07 and 2018; Louisville (40-22) clinched its sixth appearance after defeating Miami (Fla.) in Game 3 of the Louisville Super Regional, 3-2.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: No. 13 seed Coastal Carolina (53-11), which makes its return to the CWS after winning the title in its debut in 2016, enters the tournament on a 23-game winning streak; Arizona (44-19) seeks its fifth title overall and first since 2012.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Oklahoma City won both season meetings with the Pacers, including a 132-111 home win on March 29 behind 33 points and eight assists from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander; Indiana makes its first Finals appearance since 2000 after beating New York, 4-2.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: Murray State (44-15) makes its first appearance in program history after winning the Durham Super Regional; No. 15 seed UCLA (47-16) is making its first trip to Omaha since 2013 when the Bruins won their first national title behind Adam Plutko.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: No. 6 seed LSU (48-15) took two of three from No. 3 seed Arkansas (48-13) in the season series back in May, including a 5-4 win in 10 innings on May 9 behind Kade Anderson before a 13-3 win on May 10 behind Jake Brown and Ethan Frey.

programme.title: USL Soccer
programme.desc: Rhode Island claimed a 3-0 victory against Louisville City in 2024's playoffs on Nov. 9, led by a brace from Jerome Williams after 79 minutes; Albert Dikwa found the net for Rhode Island's third goal of the win away from home in stoppage time.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two of the more prestigious names in the UFC coach their teams of up-and-coming fighters, who are in search of a UFC contract for winning the season, as they compete against each other in the Octagon and in challenges outside of the bouts.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In 1998, a year after the Chicago Bulls defeated Utah in the NBA Finals, their path to a sixth title only gets more challenging as it goes along, as a brutal seven-game series against the Indiana Pacers decides the Eastern Conference.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan pushes his teammates hard for a sixth NBA title, his intensity and hunger for basketball dominance is in stark contrast to his mindset in October 1993, when he stunned the world by walking away from the game.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan would famously use even the smallest slight imaginable to motivate himself against an opponent, and when his NBA comeback in 1995 fell short in the playoffs, he worked harder than ever to return to form and prove his doubters wrong.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In June of 1998, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls take on the Utah Jazz in an NBA Finals rematch that saw the Bulls win in six games in the 1997 Finals, looking for a sixth championship and a perfect ending for "The Last Dance."

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years, but "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Canadian Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; George Russell finished with a 72-second lap time last year to win his first pole at Canada but finished in third.

programme.title: College Track & Field
programme.desc: The NCAA's outdoor track & field season culminates with the 2025 Men's and Women's Division I Championships at Hayward Field in Eugene, Oregon, from June 11 to 14; Men's and Women's events alternate days starting with Men's Day 1.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season as a key defender and rebounder.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: For three incarcerated men serving life terms at San Quentin State Prison, the unique 105-lap, 26.2-mile marathon around the prison yard gives them an opportunity and redefining themselves and a chance at transforming who they are.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan is left to begin the 1997-98 season without his injured sidekick Scottie Pippen, whose contract dispute with the Bulls' front office reaches a fever pitch as the team gets off to one of the worst starts of its championship runs.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: Sport Fishing TV
programme.desc: Sport Fishing magazine's executive editor, award-winning marine journalist and host John Brownlee goes to exotic locations around the world to showcase abundant fisheries during their peak seasons and focusing on specific species.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the 1995 NBA Eastern Conference semifinals Reggie Miller became known as "The Garden's Greatest Villain," when he continuously broke the hearts of the New York Knicks, while leading the Indiana Pacers and waging a war of words with New York fans.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Canada; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Documentary films detailing intriguing sports stories that captured the imagination of the fans or have been overlooked with the passage of time, showcasing footage and interviews with the athletes involved to give an in-depth retrospective.

programme.title: Sportsman's Adventures with Captain Rick Murphy
programme.desc: Captain Rick Murphy, the all-time winningest saltwater tournament angler in the United States, who boats 139 titles to date, goes fishing with a wide variety of passionate anglers in a multitude of thriving fishing holes.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-4) split two meetings with the Battlehawks this season after earning a 27-15 triumph on the road in Week 3; St. Louis (8-2), the defending champion and winner of its last six contests, led the UFL with just 16.3 points allowed per game in 2025.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Moldova (0-0-2) plays its first match on the road after falling to Norway (March 22) and Estonia (March 25); Italy (0-0-1), which allowed three first-half goals to suffer a 3-0 setback to Norway in Week 3, is 3-0-0 all-time against Selectionata.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-4) split two meetings with the Battlehawks this season after earning a 27-15 triumph on the road in Week 3; St. Louis (8-2), the defending champion and winner of its last six contests, led the UFL with just 16.3 points allowed per game in 2025.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Unprecedented drivers' seat access to the top NTT IndyCar Series as they compete in the greatest racing event on the planet - the Indianapolis 500.

programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Gateway; crews work to set up the car.

programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Gateway; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
MLS Soccer
programme.desc: San Jose claimed victories against Portland in their first two meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup in the US Open Cup round of 16, 1-0, after extra time; Jack Skahan found the net with the winner in the second half of extra time.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Brenden Queen secured his third win of the season and second in the last three races with his victory at Michigan over Corey Heim to lead Lavar Scott by six points; William Sawalich won the last two races at Berlin after beating Scott last year.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Panama ousted defending champion United States on penalty kicks in the semifinals, 5-4, as Orlando Mosquera made two saves; Mexico, which leads all teams with eight Gold Cup titles, cruised past Jamaica in its semifinal matchup, 3-0, on July 12.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: FIFA World Cup 26: One Year To Go
programme.desc: A celebration of reaching the one-year-to-go mark until the world's greatest sporting event, including live performances and interviews with FIFA dignitaries, international and U.S. soccer legends and more throughout the night.

programme.title: The Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The seventh stop of 2025, as competitors look for the lake's largemouth, smallmouth and spotted bass; the Elites last competed on Tenkiller in 2019, as Carl Jocumsen won that regular-season finale to become the first Australian Bassmaster champion.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Sixteen national teams compete in CONCACAF's premier association competition to determine the continental champion of the North America, Central America and the Caribbean; the biennial tournament celebrated its debut in 1991.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Scott McLaughlin averaged 179.972 mph to win the pole at Gateway last year before finishing the race in second.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.desc: Indy NXT drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Gateway; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Austin Green secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Charlotte over Grant Enfinger; Connor Zilisch averaged 149.44 en route to his win at Michigan last year, beating eventual 2024 champion Andres Perez by 0.701 seconds.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: St. George Illawarra (5-0-7) fell to Dolphins, 56-6, in Round 14; Cronulla (7-0-6) has won the 10 previous meetings with the Dragons, including a 38-10 victory last season at WIN Stadium in Round 25, as seven different Sharks notched a try.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Rajah Caruth secured his first win of the season with his victory at Nashville over points leader Corey Heim, his eighth podium finish of 2025; Truck Series races at Michigan for the first time since Zane Smith won in 2020 over Christian Eckes.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the sprint race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.
